channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 英国禁止香烟和一次性吸管的计划很受欢迎。但是，世界另一端的两个国家的经验表明要谨慎从事👇。
item.description:
Britain’s plans to ban cigarettes and disposable vapes are popular. But the experiences of two countries on the other side of the world suggest caution https://t.co/4KMZueb2cy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 准妈妈很快就能在显微镜下看到属于她感觉到在体内踢动的婴儿的肺部复制品： 👇
item.description:
A prospective mother could soon look down a microscope and see a replica lung belonging to the baby she feels kicking inside.

Learn how: https://t.co/NXfEEtjhUF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 沃达丰的价值曾一度超过苹果。发生了什么？这家英国电信公司正试图通过瘦身恢复健康 👇
item.description:
Vodafone was once worth more than Apple. What happened? The British telecoms company is trying to slim its way back to health https://t.co/yJiIzZJ1dw 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 自杜瓦利埃独裁统治垮台以来的 38 年里，海地人经历了 19 次领导层更迭。第20次即将到来 ⬇️
item.description:
Haitians have suffered through 19 changes of leadership in the 38 years since the Duvalier dictatorship fell. The 20th is nigh https://t.co/rHpU5RcQsF ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登在工会咨文演说中发出了一个信号：他认识到唐纳德-特朗普已将美国政治带入了新的领域--他打算在那里与唐纳德-特朗普展开斗争 ⬇️
item.description:
In his state-of-the-union speech, Joe Biden sent a signal that he recognises Donald Trump has shifted American politics onto new terrain—and that he intends to take the fight to him there https://t.co/KjFZz3EKB7 ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）和礼来（Eli Lilly）现在正在印钞票。但它们不会成为停滞不前的双头垄断者。减肥药市场很快就会大变样👇。
item.description:
Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly are printing money now. But they will not be a stagnant duopoly.

The weight-loss drugs market will soon look drastically different https://t.co/qmhzI4Zkoo 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 痴情、孩子、通奸：婚姻是奥斯卡的主题
item.description:
Infatuation, kids, adultery: marriage is the theme of the Oscars https://t.co/29Lwn04S6N

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，天文学家已经能够测量暗物质的行为，并能指出天空中暗物质一定存在的地方。但它究竟是什么，这仍然是个谜。新的理论可以提供线索： 👇
item.description:
For decades astronomers have been able to measure how dark matter behaves and can point to parts of the sky where it must exist. But what it actually is—that remains a mystery.

New theories could yield clues: https://t.co/m2hM1C2NYa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 增加女性董事会人数是否有商业价值？2020 年，咨询公司发现，董事会性别多样性排名前四分位数的公司比排名后四分位数的公司有 25% 的可能性超越行业平均水平 👇 。
item.description:
Is there a business case for more female boards? In 2020 consultants found that firms in the top quartile for board gender diversity were 25% likelier to outperform their industry average than those in the bottom quartile https://t.co/x7ss5NYgpv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 活到 120 岁正成为一个可以想象的前景。令人兴奋的是，这些额外的岁月将是健康的，但会产生广泛的影响👇。
item.description:
Living to 120 is becoming an imaginable prospect. Excitingly, those extra years would be healthy—but there would be wide ramifications https://t.co/yaScPYNvbv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 财政大臣以提高生产力为由减税。这是错误的做法 👇

item.title: 中国的政治比以往任何时候都更加不透明，但所传达的信息却是明确无误的：经济仍在失灵，权力正在集中，习近平坚定不移地专注于与美国的较量 👇 👇。
item.description:
Chinese politics is more opaque than ever, but the message is unmistakable: the economy is still misfiring, power is concentrating and Xi Jinping is unwaveringly focused on the contest with America https://t.co/1cY5uQeADN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 黑客电话的直接损害是德国的声誉。长期的影响可能是国内的 👇。
item.description:

item.title: 本周，在北京可以感受到一种奇怪的缺席。当一年一度的全国人民代表大会会议开始时，中国的 "不高兴的人 "不见了 👇。
item.description:
A curious absence could be felt in Beijing this week. When the annual session of the National People’s Congress began, China’s unhappy people were missing https://t.co/HaXespJ996 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 性问题被认为是造成五分之一到一半离婚的原因。减少这一数字将使许多成人和儿童免于痛苦和贫困👇。
item.description:
Sexual issues are thought to contribute to between a ﬁfth and half of all divorces. Reducing that number would spare many adults and children from misery and impoverishment https://t.co/mFAtE2WCK8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 过去十年间，中国运行的卫星数量大幅增加，总数已超过 600 颗。这是否值得担忧？有了人工智能的帮助，美国可能会担心👇。
item.description:
Over the past decade China has massively increased the number of satellites it has in operation, to a total of over 600.

Is this a cause for concern? With AI helping out, it could be for America https://t.co/dq9FiV3tLI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。发展中国家--尤其是印度--应该学习孟加拉国公开、务实的尝试，防止这种情况发生👇。
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Developing countries—especially India—should learn from Bangladesh’s open, pragmatic attempts to prevent this from happening https://t.co/YoBfojuGwr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 作者川上美惠子（Mieko Kawakami）在为《经济学人》撰写的客座文章中指出，父亲们必须正视自己无意识中的假设，才能为女性创造一个更美好的世界。
item.description:
Fathers must confront their unconscious assumptions if they are to make the world a better place for women, argues the author Mieko Kawakami in a guest essay for The Economist https://t.co/A9UTQT4zZg

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 中国在太空计划上的花费比任何国家都多，美国除外。卫星是一个特别值得关注的领域。美国军舰要小心了 👇。
item.description:
China spends more on its space programme than any country bar America. An area of particular concern is satellites.

American warships should watch out https://t.co/WVHZYoixDc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 最新研究显示，全球最便宜的 20 座城市中有 9 座位于亚洲。但亚洲大陆也有一些世界上最昂贵的大都市👇。
item.description:
Nine of the world’s 20 cheapest cities are in Asia, according to new research. But the continent is also home to some of the world’s most exorbitant metropolises https://t.co/2iZn68eW6a 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024
